titleStmt.title: A brief character of the Protector Oliver Cromwel with an account of the slavery he left the nation under at his death, comprehended in a seasonable speech concerning the upper house / made by a worthy member of Parliament in the House of Commons, March 1659.
titleStmt.author: Titus, Silius, 1623?-1704.

titleStmt.title: A brief character of the Protector Oliver Cromwel with an account of the slavery he left the nation under at his death, comprehended in a seasonable speech concerning the upper house / made by a worthy member of Parliament in the House of Commons, March 1659.
titleStmt.author: Titus, Silius, 1623?-1704.
Shaftesbury, Anthony Ashley Cooper, Earl of, 1621-1683.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed and are to be sold by R. Taylor,

notesStmt.note: Another edition of "A seasonable speech made by a worthy member of Parliament" which is attributed by Wing to the Earl of Shaftesbury, but was probably written by Silas Titus according to Abbot, A bibliography of Oliver Cromwell, no. 1025.
Reproduction of original in the Trinity College Library, Cambridge University.
